line_1: That seeing only mark'd but half our faults.
line_2: It gave some courage to our troubled thoughts,

line_1: Improves his Beauties, and corrects his Faults;
line_2: Who freely judges of an Author's Thoughts,

line_1: And chuse to mimic all their faults,
line_2: Tag Butler's rhimes to Prior's thoughts,

line_1: Laugh at their follies, ere you weep their faults:
line_2: Let not their vices yet employ thy thoughts,

line_1: To shew us private, or the publick Faults.
line_2: But urge thy Pen, if thou wou'd'st move our Thoughts,

line_1: 'Twas damn'd hypocrisy to hide one's faults;
line_2: He swore, the world was welcome to his thoughts:

line_1: The magpye blabs out all her faults;
line_2: The yelping cur her heels assaults,

line_1: With ease may irritate his faults.
line_2: Who cannot reach his style, or thoughts,

line_1: But lik'd the youth with all his faults;

line_2: How vain are all my Thoughts?

line_1: Those Freer Beauties, ev'n in Them, seem Faults.
line_2: I know there are, to whose presumptuous Thoughts

line_1: So often I reprov'd their slothful Faults,
line_2: And with such Freedom told 'em all my Thoughts,
But all in vain are Pray'rs, extatick Thoughts,
